Date time of the start of the period.
Length of the averaging period in ISO8601 duration format.
The air temperature 2 meters above ground.
solar azimuth angle (degrees). Zero means true north. Vaies from -180 to 180. A value of -90 means the sun is in the east.
the attenuation of incoming light due to cloud. Varies from 0 (no cloud) to 100 (full attenuation of incoming light).
The dewpoint temperature 2 meters above ground level.
The total irradiance received on a horizontal surface. It is the sum of the horizontal components of direct (beam) and diffuse irradiance.
The horizontal component of diffuse irradiance (irradiance that is scattered by the atmosphere).
Solar irradiance arriving in a direct line from the sun as measured on a surface held perpendicular to the sun.
The horizontal component of direct normal irradiance.
The total irradiance received on a surface with defined tilt and azimuth, fixed or tracking.
precipitable water (kg/m2) of entire atmospheric column.
The air relative humidity (2 meters above ground level).
The air pressure at ground level.

The wind direction (10 meters above ground level). This is the meteorological convention. 0 is a northerly (from the north); 90 is an easterly (from the east); 180 is a southerly (from the south); 270 is a westerly (from the west).
Wind speed at 10m above ground level.
The angle between a line perpendicular to the earth's surface and the sun (90 deg = sunrise and sunset; 0 deg = sun directly overhead)
The average daytime surface reflectivity of visible light, expressed as a value between 0 and 1. 0 represents complete absorption. 1 represents complete reflection.
